billEvents.eventText: REFERRED TO CRIME VICTIMS, CRIME AND CORRECTION

title: Provides that crime victim over 60 years of age is eligible for office of victim services award regardless of financial status
summary: Eliminates the requirement of serious financial hardship incurred as the result of a crime as a qualification for an award from the crime victims board for victims who are over 60 years of age.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         2577

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                   I N  S E N A T E

                                   January 26, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  Sen.  KRUGER -- read twice and ordered printed, and when
         printed to be committed to the Committee on Crime Victims,  Crime  and
         Correction

       AN ACT to amend the executive law, in relation to eligibility for awards
         from the office of victim services

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Subdivision 6 of  section  631  of  the  executive  law  is
    2  amended by adding a new paragraph (f) to read as follows:
    3    (F)  IN THE EVENT THAT A CLAIMANT IS A PERSON OVER SIXTY YEARS OF AGE,
    4  THE PROVISIONS OF PARAGRAPH (A) OF THIS SUBDIVISION SHALL NOT APPLY.
    5    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately and  shall  apply  to  all
    6  claims pending and filed on and after such date.







        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD07153-01-1
actClause: AN ACT to amend the executive law, in relation to eligibility for awards from the office of victim services
